intro: Phyllanthus rouxii, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique morphology and adaptability to harsh conditions make it an important species in its native ecosystem. It is also used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
